description.narrative: The impact of this program is for migration to be safer and more orderly and to provide critical humanitarian support, resulting in fewer deaths and less suffering along migration routes. It targets 3 aspects of migration issues: flows through Sudan toward Europe, returns to Sudan, and lack of full information about flows and risks. Hostcommunities will receive assistance through community-led resilience and livelihoods programming as a vehicle for the delivery of protection intervention.

The impact of this project is for migration to be safer and more orderly, to provide critical humanitarian support, resulting in fewer deaths and less suffering along migration routes. Outcomes of the project are: Outcome 1: Migrants and refugees in transit, particularly the most vulnerable, are protected from harm and are able to meet their basic needs Outcome 2: More refugees are able to access long-term protection and durable solutions Outcome 3: Government, humanitarian agencies and national organisations have improved understanding of causes and dynamics of migration and improve their response WHH will work directly towards Outcome 1 and contributes indirectly to Outcomes 2 & 3.

WHH contribution: 12,000 migrants, refugees and host community members in 4 hosting communities receive community development support (incl. 6,000 persons reached with direct household-level support) Total project: 24,710 refugees, asylum seekers, migrants and host community members: 180 members of Community Based Protection Networks in host/transit communities 200 migrants referred through enhanced/set-up referral mechanisms 200 migrants provided with individual case management 2,270 migrants reached with humanitarian support (Cash/vouchers, NFls, hygiene/dignity Kits, foster care) 40 staff and volunteers of community safe house associations trained and supported 15,000 migrants, would-be migrants and host community members targeted with information and outreach Direct WHH contribution: 12,000 migrants
